text: R5.9. Page table bits and levels A CPU uses virtual addresses that are 48 bits long, and has 4096 byte pages. Page table entries are 8 bytes long, and the higher-order 18 bits of the virtual address are unused. Assume no space in the page tables is wasted. How many PTEs does each page table contain? =~ 512 How many levels of page tables does this CPU have? 5
